Question: Your full legal name (if you are a sole proprietor, your last, first, and middle names):
Business Definition: The complete legal name of the adviser, including the last, first, and middle names for sole proprietors.

Question: Name under which you primarily conduct your advisory business, if different from Item 1.A.
Business Definition: The name under which the advisory business is primarily conducted, if different from the legal name provided in Item 1.A.

Question: If you are using this Form ADV to register more than one investment adviser under an umbrella registration, check this box.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the Form ADV is being used to register multiple investment advisers under an umbrella registration.

Question: If this filing is reporting a change in your legal name (Item 1.A.) or primary business name (Item 1.B.(1)), enter the new name and specify whether the name change is of your legal name or your primary business name:
Business Definition: The new legal or business name being reported and the type of name change (legal name or business name).

Question: If you are registered with the SEC as an investment adviser, your SEC file number: 801-.
Business Definition: The SEC file number (801-) assigned to the investment adviser registered with the SEC.

Question: If you report to the SEC as an exempt reporting adviser, your SEC file number: 802-.
Business Definition: The SEC file number (802-) assigned to the exempt reporting adviser.

Question: If you have one or more Central Index Key numbers assigned by the SEC ('CIK Numbers'), all of your CIK numbers:.
Business Definition: The Central Index Key (CIK) numbers assigned by the SEC to the adviser.

Question: If you have a number ('CRD Number') assigned by the FINRA's CRD system or by the IARD system, your CRD number:.
Business Definition: The Central Registration Depository (CRD) number assigned to the adviser by FINRA or IARD.

Question: If you have additional CRD Numbers, your additional CRD numbers:.
Business Definition: Any additional CRD numbers assigned to the adviser.

Question: Address (do not use a P.O. Box):
Business Definition: The physical address of the principal office and place of business of the adviser, not using a P.O. Box.

Question: Days of week that you normally conduct business at your principal office and place of business: Monday - Friday, Other: Normal business hours at this location:
Business Definition: The days of the week and the normal business hours during which business is conducted at the principal office and place of business of the adviser.

Question: Telephone number at this location: (area code)
Business Definition: The telephone number at the principal office and place of business.

Question: Facsimile number at this location, if any: (area code)
Business Definition: The facsimile (fax) number at the principal office and place of business, if available.

Question: What is the total number of offices, other than your principal office and place of business, at which you conduct investment advisory business as of the end of your most recently completed fiscal year?
Business Definition: The total number of offices, excluding the principal office, where investment advisory business is conducted as of the end of the most recent fiscal year.

Question: Mailing address, if different from your principal office and place of business address: (number and street, city, state/country, zip +4/postal code)
Business Definition: The mailing address, if different from the principal office and place of business address.

Question: If you are a sole proprietor, state your full residence address, if different from your principal office and place of business address in Item 1.F .: (number and street, city, state/country, zip +4/postal code)
Business Definition: The full residence address of the sole proprietor, if it is different from the principal office and place of business address.

Question: Do you have one or more websites or accounts on publicly available social media platforms (including, but not limited to, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn)? Yes/No
Expected Data Element: Websites/Social Media [Yes/No], List of Websites/Social Media
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser has any websites or accounts on publicly available social media platforms, and if so, lists those websites and social media accounts.

Question: Provide the name and contact information of your Chief Compliance Officer.
Business Definition: The name and contact information of the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO).

Question: If your Chief Compliance Officer is compensated or employed by any person other than you, a related person or an investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940 that you advise for providing chief compliance officer services to you, provide the person's name and IRS Employer Identification Number (if any):
Expected Data Element: CCO Employer Name, CCO Employer EIN
Business Definition: The name and IRS Employer Identification Number (EIN) of the entity compensating or employing the Chief Compliance Officer, other than the adviser.

Question: Additional Regulatory Contact Person: If a person other than the Chief Compliance Officer is authorized to receive information and respond to questions about this Form ADV, you may provide that information here.
Business Definition: The name and contact information of an additional regulatory contact person authorized to receive information and respond to questions about the Form ADV.

Question: Do you maintain some or all of the books and records you are required to keep under Section 204 of the Advisers Act, or similar state law, somewhere other than your principal office and place of business? Yes/No
Business Definition: Indicates whether books and records are maintained somewhere other than the principal office and place of business, and if so, provides the address.

Question: Are you registered with a foreign financial regulatory authority? Yes/No
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is registered with any foreign financial regulatory authority, and provides the name of the authority if applicable.

Question: Are you a public reporting company under Sections 12 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934? Yes/No
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a public reporting company under Sections 12 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

Question: Did you have $1 billion or more in assets on the last day of your most recent fiscal year? Yes/No
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser had $1 billion or more in assets on the last day of their most recent fiscal year.

Question: Provide your Legal Entity Identifier if you have one:.
Business Definition: The Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) of the adviser, if available.

Question: To register (or remain registered) with the SEC, you must check at least one of the Items 2.A.(1) through 2.A.(12), below. If you are submitting an annual updating amendment to your SEC registration and you are no longer eligible to register with the SEC, check Item 2.A.(13). Part 1A Instruction 2 provides information to help you determine whether you may affirmatively respond to each of these items.
Business Definition: Indicates the basis under which the adviser is eligible to register or remain registered with the SEC.

Question: You (the adviser): are a large advisory firm that has regulatory assets under management of $100 million (in U.S. dollars) or more;
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a large firm with regulatory assets under management (RAUM) of $100 million or more.

Question: You (the adviser): are a large advisory firm that has regulatory assets under management of $90 million (in U.S. dollars) or more at the time of filing its most recent annual updating amendment and is registered with the SEC;
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a large firm with regulatory assets under management (RAUM) of $90 million or more at the time of the most recent amendment.

Question: You (the adviser): are a mid-sized advisory firm that has regulatory assets under management of $25 million (in U.S. dollars) or more but less than $100 million (in U.S. dollars) and you are not required to be registered as an adviser with the state securities authority of the state where you maintain your principal office and place of business;
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a mid-sized firm with regulatory assets under management (RAUM) of $25-100 million, not required to register with state authorities.

Question: You (the adviser): are a mid-sized advisory firm that has regulatory assets under management of $25 million (in U.S. dollars) or more but less than $100 million (in U.S. dollars) and you are not subject to examination by the state securities authority of the state where you maintain your principal office and place of business;
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a mid-sized firm with regulatory assets under management (RAUM) of $25-100 million, not subject to state examination.

Question: You (the adviser): Reserved;
Business Definition: Placeholder for a reserved item with no current use.

Question: You (the adviser): have your principal office and place of business outside the United States;
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser's principal office and place of business are located outside the United States.

Question: You (the adviser): are an investment adviser (or subadviser) to an investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940;
Expected Data Element: Investment Adviser to Registered Investment Company [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or is an investment adviser or subadviser to a company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940.

Question: You (the adviser): are an investment adviser to a company which has elected to be a business development company pursuant to section 54 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 and has not withdrawn the election, and you have at least $25 million of regulatory assets under management;
Expected Data Element: Investment Adviser to Business Development Company [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is an investment adviser to a company that elected as a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940.

Question: You (the adviser): are a pension consultant with respect to assets of plans having an aggregate value of at least $200,000,000 that qualifies for the exemption in rule 203A-2(a);
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a pension consultant with assets under management of at least $200 million, qualifying for rule 203A-2(a) exemption.

Question: You (the adviser): are a related adviser under rule 203A-2(b) that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, an investment adviser that is registered with the SEC, and your principal office and place of business is the same as the registered adviser. If you check this box, complete Section 2.A.(8) of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is related under rule 203A-2(b), either controlling, being controlled by, or under common control with an SEC-registered adviser.

Question: You (the adviser): are an adviser relying on rule 203A-2(c) because you expect to be eligible for SEC registration within 120 days; If you check this box, complete Section 2.A.(9) of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is relying on rule 203A-2(c) and expects to be eligible for SEC registration within 120 days.

Question: You (the adviser): are a multi-state adviser that is required to register in 15 or more states and is relying on rule 203A-2(d); If you check this box, complete Section 2.A.(10) of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is a multi-state adviser required to register in 15 or more states and is relying on rule 203A-2(d).

Question: You (the adviser): are an Internet adviser relying on rule 203A-2(e); If you check this box, complete Section 2.A.(11) of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is an Internet adviser, relying on rule 203A-2(e).

Question: You (the adviser): have received an SEC order exempting you from the prohibition against registration with the SEC; If you check this box, complete Section 2.A.(12) of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser has received an SEC order exempting them from prohibition against registration with the SEC, along with order details.

Question: You (the adviser): are no longer eligible to remain registered with the SEC.
Expected Data Element: No Longer Eligible for SEC Registration [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is no longer eligible to remain registered with the SEC.

Question: Complete this Item 2.B. only if you are reporting to the SEC as an exempt reporting adviser. Check all that apply. You:
Business Definition: Indicates the adviser's status as an exempt reporting adviser.

Question: You (the adviser): qualify for the exemption from registration as an adviser solely to one or more venture capital funds, as defined in rule 203(l)-1;
Expected Data Element: Exempt as Adviser to Venture Capital Fund [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser qualifies for exemption as an adviser solely to venture capital funds, defined under rule 203(l)-1.

Question: You (the adviser): qualify for the exemption from registration because you act solely as an adviser to private funds and have assets under management, as defined in rule 203(m)-1, in the United States of less than $150 million;
Expected Data Element: Exempt as Adviser to Private Funds with < $150M RAUM [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser qualifies for exemption as an adviser to private funds with assets under management of less than $150 million.

Question: You (the adviser): act solely as an adviser to private funds but you are no longer eligible to check box 2.B.(2) because you have assets under management, as defined in rule 203(m)-1, in the United States of $150 million or more.
Expected Data Element: Adviser to Private Funds with $150M+ RAUM [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is no longer eligible for exemption as adviser to private funds due to assets under management of $150 million or more.

Question: If you check box 2.B.(2) or 2.B.(3), complete Section 2.B. of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates when Section 2.B of Schedule D needs to be completed.

Question: Under state laws, SEC-registered advisers may be required to provide to state securities authorities a copy of the Form ADV and any amendments they file with the SEC. These are called notice filings. In addition, exempt reporting advisers may be required to provide state securities authorities with a copy of reports and any amendments they file with the SEC. If this is an initial application or report, check the box(es) next to the state(s) that you would like to receive notice of this and all subsequent filings or reports you submit to the SEC. If this is an amendment to direct your notice filings or reports to additional state(s), check the box(es) next to the state(s) that you would like to receive notice of this and all subsequent filings or reports you submit to the SEC. If this is an amendment to your registration to stop your notice filings or reports from going to states that currently receive them, uncheck the box(es) next to those state(s).
Business Definition: Indicates the states that will receive notice filings or reports based on the adviser's initial application, amendments, or updates.

Question: If you are amending your registration to stop your notice filings or reports from going to a state that currently receives them and you do not want to pay that state’s notice filing or report filing fee for the coming year, your amendment must be filed before the end of the year (December 31).
Expected Data Element: Amendment for State Notice Filings [State Names]
Business Definition: Indicates which states are impacted when amending registrations to stop notice filings or reports and avoid filing fees for the upcoming year.

Question: How are you organized? (Corporation, Partnership, Other (specify), Sole Proprietorship, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP), Limited Liability Company (LLC), Limited Partnership (LP))
Business Definition: The legal structure under which the adviser entity is organized.

Question: If you are changing your response to this item, see Part 1A Instruction 4.
Business Definition: Instruction referencing where to find more information if organization type changes.

Question: In what month does your fiscal year end each year?
Business Definition: The specific month in which the adviser's fiscal year concludes annually.

Question: Under the laws of what state or country are you organized?
Business Definition: The state or country legislation under which the advisory entity is officially formed.

Question: If you are a partnership, provide the name of the state or country under whose laws your partnership was formed.
Business Definition: The state or country under whose legal jurisdiction the partnership organization was established.

Question: If you are a sole proprietor, provide the name of the state or country where you reside.
Business Definition: The state or country in which a sole proprietor resides.

Question: If you are changing your response to this item, see Part 1A Instruction 4.
Business Definition: Instruction on where to find details when updating the organizational information.

Question: Are you, at the time of this filing, succeeding to the business of a registered investment adviser, including, for example, a change of your structure or legal status (e.g., form of organization or state of incorporation)? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Whether the adviser is succeeding to an already registered advisory business, leading to entity structure or legal modifications.

Question: If "yes," complete Item 4.B. and Section 4 of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Guidance to provide additional forms and sections if succeeding another registered advisory business.

Question: Date of Succession: (mm/dd/yyyy)
Business Definition: The date on which succession or transfer of business from the predecessor to the current adviser occurred.

Question: If you have already reported this succession on a previous Form ADV filing, do not report the succession again. Instead, check "No." See Part 1A Instruction 4.
Business Definition: Instructions on avoiding redundancy in successive reporting if previously documented, with reference to the guidance.

Question: Approximately how many employees do you have? Include full- and part-time employees but do not include any clerical workers.
Business Definition: The total count of full- and part-time employees excluding clerical workers.

Question: Approximately how many of the employees reported in 5.A. perform investment advisory functions (including research)?
Business Definition: Number of employees performing investment advisory functions, including research, out of the total employees reported in 5.A.

Question: Approximately how many of the employees reported in 5.A. are registered representatives of a broker-dealer?
Business Definition: Number of employees registered as representatives of a broker-dealer among the employees reported in 5.A.

Question: Approximately how many of the employees reported in 5.A. are registered with one or more state securities authorities as investment adviser representatives?
Business Definition: Number of employees registered with one or more state securities authorities as investment adviser representatives among the employees reported in 5.A.

Question: Approximately how many of the employees reported in 5.A. are registered with one or more state securities authorities as investment adviser representatives for an investment adviser other than you?
Business Definition: Number of employees registered with state securities authorities as investment adviser representatives for an adviser other than the reporting adviser.

Question: Approximately how many of the employees reported in 5.A. are licensed agents of an insurance company or agency?
Business Definition: Number of employees who are licensed agents of an insurance company or agency among the employees reported in 5.A.

Question: Approximately how many firms or other persons solicit advisory clients on your behalf?
Business Definition: Number of firms or other persons that solicit advisory clients on behalf of the adviser (excluding employees).

Question: To approximately how many clients for whom you do not have regulatory assets under management did you provide investment advisory services during your most recently completed fiscal year?
Business Definition: Number of clients who received investment advisory services but for whom the adviser does not have regulatory assets under management during the most recent fiscal year.

Question: Approximately what percentage of your clients are non-United States persons? %
Business Definition: Percentage of the total client base that consists of non-United States persons.

Question: Indicate the approximate number of your clients and amount of your total regulatory assets under management (reported in Item 5.F. below) attributable to each of the following type of client. [See detailed types below]
Type of Client (a) Individuals (other than high net worth individuals)
Business Definition: Type of clients receiving advisory services, starting with individuals other than high net worth individuals.

Question: Number of Client(s) (a)
Business Definition: Number of clients in each client type classification.

Question: Fewer than 5 Clients
Business Definition: Indicator if there are fewer than 5 clients in a specific client type.

Question: Amount of Regulatory Assets under Management (a)
Business Definition: Amount of regulatory assets under management for each type of client classification.

Question: You are compensated for your investment advisory services by (check all that apply):
Business Definition: Methods through which the adviser is compensated for providing investment advisory services.

Question: A percentage of assets under your management
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by percentage of assets under management.

Question: Hourly charges
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by hourly charges.

Question: Subscription fees (for a newsletter or periodical)
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by subscription fees for newsletters or periodicals.

Question: Fixed fees (other than subscription fees)
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by fixed fees (excluding subscription fees).

Question: Commissions
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by commissions received.

Question: Performance-based fees
Business Definition: Indicates compensation by performance-based fees.

Question: Other (specify):
Business Definition: Indicates other compensation methods along with specific details if applicable.

Question: Do you provide continuous and regular supervisory or management services to securities portfolios? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser provides continuous and regular supervisory or management services to securities portfolios.

Question: If yes, what is the amount of your regulatory assets under management and total number of accounts?
Business Definition: The specific amount of regulatory assets under management and the total number of accounts if the adviser provides continuous and regular supervisory or management services.

Question: Discretionary: $ and Total Number of Accounts
Business Definition: Total amount of discretionary regulatory assets under management and number of related accounts.

Question: Non-Discretionary: $ and Total Number of Accounts
Business Definition: Total amount of non-discretionary regulatory assets under management and number of related accounts.

Question: Total: $ and Total Number of Accounts
Business Definition: Total amount of both discretionary and non-discretionary regulatory assets under management and number of related accounts.

Question: What is the approximate amount of your total regulatory assets under management (reported in Item 5.F.(2)(c) above) attributable to clients who are non-United States persons?
Business Definition: Approximate amount of regulatory assets under management attributable to clients who are non-United States persons.

Question: What type(s) of advisory services do you provide? (Check all that apply)
Business Definition: The specific types of advisory services that the adviser provides.

Question: Financial planning services
Business Definition: Indicates whether financial planning services are provided.

Question: Portfolio management for individuals and/or small businesses
Business Definition: Indicates whether portfolio management services are provided for individuals and/or small businesses.

Question: Portfolio management for investment companies (as well as 'business development companies' that have made an election pursuant to section 54 of the Investment Company Act of 1940)
Business Definition: Indicates whether portfolio management services are provided for investment companies and business development companies.

Question: Portfolio management for pooled investment vehicles (other than investment companies)
Expected Data Element: Portfolio Management for Pooled Investment Vehicles [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether portfolio management services are provided for pooled investment vehicles other than investment companies.

Question: Portfolio management for businesses (other than small businesses) or institutional clients (other than registered investment companies and other pooled investment vehicles)
Business Definition: Indicates whether portfolio management services are provided for businesses other than small businesses or institutional clients.

Question: Pension consulting services
Business Definition: Indicates whether pension consulting services are provided.

Question: Selection of other advisers (including private fund managers)
Business Definition: Indicates whether services include the selection of other advisers (including private fund managers).

Question: Publication of periodicals or newsletters
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser publishes periodicals or newsletters.

Question: Security ratings or pricing services
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser provides security ratings or pricing services.

Question: Market timing services
Business Definition: Indicates whether market timing services are provided.

Question: Educational seminars/workshops
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser conducts educational seminars or workshops.

Question: Other (specify):
Business Definition: Indicates other advisory services provided, with specific details if applicable.

Question: If you provide financial planning services, to how many clients did you provide these services during your last fiscal year?
Business Definition: The number of clients who received financial planning services during the adviser's last fiscal year.

Question: Select: 0, 1-10, 11-25, 26-50, 51-100, 101-250, 251-500, More than 500 (specify how many if more than 500)
Business Definition: Options to specify the range of clients receiving financial planning services.

Question: Do you participate in a wrap fee program? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser participates in a wrap fee program.

Question: If you participate in a wrap fee program, what is the amount of your regulatory assets under management attributable to acting as:
sponsor to a wrap fee program $
Expected Data Element: AUM as Wrap Fee Program Sponsor
Business Definition: Amount of regulatory assets under management attributable to acting as a sponsor to a wrap fee program.

Question: portfolio manager for a wrap fee program? $
Expected Data Element: AUM as Wrap Fee Program Portfolio Manager
Business Definition: Amount of regulatory assets under management attributable to acting as a portfolio manager for a wrap fee program.

Question: sponsor to and portfolio manager for the same wrap fee program? $
Expected Data Element: AUM as Wrap Fee Program Sponsor & Portfolio Manager
Business Definition: Amount of regulatory assets under management attributable to acting as both a sponsor and portfolio manager for the same wrap fee program.

Question: In response to Item 4.B. of Part 2A of Form ADV, do you indicate that you provide investment advice only with respect to limited types of investments? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser provides investment advice only with respect to limited types of investments.

Question: Do you report client assets in Item 4.E. of Part 2A that are computed using a different method than the method used to compute your regulatory assets under management? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the client assets are computed using a different methodology than the one used for regulatory assets under management.

Question: Do you have regulatory assets under management attributable to clients other than those listed in Item 5.D.(3)(d)-(f) (separately managed account clients)? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether there are regulatory assets under management attributed to separately managed account clients not listed in Item 5.D.(3)(d)-(f).

Question: Do you engage in borrowing transactions on behalf of any of the separately managed account clients that you advise? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser engages in borrowing transactions on behalf of any separately managed account clients.

Question: Do you engage in derivative transactions on behalf of any of the separately managed account clients that you advise? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser engages in derivative transactions on behalf of any separately managed account clients.

Question: Does any custodian hold ten percent or more of the remaining amount of regulatory assets under management after subtracting items in Item 5.D.(3)(d)-(f)? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether any custodian holds ten percent or more of the remaining regulatory assets after subtracting amounts listed in Item 5.D.(3)(d)-(f).

Question: Do any of your advertisements include:
Business Definition: Elements included in advertisements published by the adviser.

Question: Performance results? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether performance results are included in advertisements.

Question: A reference to specific investment advice provided by you? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether specific investment advice is referenced in advertisements.

Question: Testimonials (other than those that satisfy rule 206(4)-1(b)(4)(ii))? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether testimonials, excluding those satisfying rule 206(4)-1(b)(4)(ii), are included in advertisements.

Question: Endorsements (other than those that satisfy rule 206(4)-1(b)(4)(ii))? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether endorsements, excluding those satisfying rule 206(4)-1(b)(4)(ii), are included in advertisements.

Question: Third-party ratings? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether third-party ratings are included in advertisements.

Question: If you answer 'yes' to 5.L(1)(c), (d), or (e) above, do you pay or provide cash or non-cash compensation for the use of testimonials, endorsements, or third-party ratings? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether compensation is provided for the use of testimonials, endorsements, or third-party ratings.

Question: Do any of your advertisements include hypothetical performance? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether hypothetical performance metrics are included in advertisements.

Question: Do any of your advertisements include predecessor performance? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether predecessor performance metrics are included in advertisements.

Question: You are actively engaged in business as a (check all that apply):
Business Definition: The types of business activities in which the adviser is actively engaged.

Question: broker-dealer (registered or unregistered)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a broker-dealer, regardless of registration status.

Question: registered representative of a broker-dealer
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm has registered representatives of a broker-dealer actively engaged in business.

Question: commodity pool operator or commodity trading advisor (whether registered or exempt from registration)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a commodity pool operator or commodity trading advisor, registered or exempt.

Question: futures commission merchant
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a futures commission merchant.

Question: real estate broker, dealer, or agent
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a real estate broker, dealer, or agent.

Question: insurance broker or agent
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as an insurance broker or agent.

Question: bank (including a separately identifiable department or division of a bank)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a bank or a separately identifiable department or division of a bank.

Question: trust company
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a trust company.

Question: registered municipal advisor
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a registered municipal advisor.

Question: registered security-based swap dealer
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a registered security-based swap dealer.

Question: major security-based swap participant
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a major security-based swap participant.

Question: accountant or accounting firm
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as an accountant or accounting firm.

Question: lawyer or law firm
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as a lawyer or law firm.

Question: other financial product salesperson (specify):
Expected Data Element: Other Financial Product Salesperson [Yes/No], Specify Sales Activity
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged as another type of financial product salesperson, with specifics.

Question: If you engage in other business using a name that is different from the names reported in Items 1.A. or 1.B.(1), complete Section 6.A. of Schedule D.
Expected Data Element: Different Business Name [Yes/No], Other Business Name, Business Activity
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm uses a different name for other business activities, specifying the alternative name and business activity.

Question: Are you actively engaged in any other business not listed in Item 6.A. (other than giving investment advice)? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm is actively engaged in other business activities not listed above, excluding investment advice.

Question: If yes, is this other business your primary business? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether this other business activity is the firm’s primary business.

Question: If 'yes,' describe this other business on Section 6.B.(2) of Schedule D, and if you engage in this business under a different name, provide that name.
Expected Data Element: Primary Business Description, Other Business Name
Business Definition: Description and, if applicable, name under which the firm engages in its primary business activity other than investment advice.

Question: Do you sell products or provide services other than investment advice to your advisory clients? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm sells products or services other than investment advice to its advisory clients.

Question: If 'yes,' describe this other business on Section 6.B.(3) of Schedule D, and if you engage in this business under a different name, provide that name.
Expected Data Element: Other Products/Services Description, Different Business Name
Business Definition: Description of other products or services provided, and if applicable, the name used for these business activities.

Question: This part of Item 7 requires you to provide information about you and your related persons, including foreign affiliates. Your related persons are all of your advisory affiliates and any person that is under common control with you.
You have a related person that is a (check all that apply):
Business Definition: Types of activities engaged in by related persons or entities under common control.

Question: broker-dealer, municipal securities dealer, or government securities broker or dealer (registered or unregistered)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a broker-dealer, municipal securities dealer, or government securities broker or dealer, regardless of registration status.

Question: other investment adviser (including financial planners)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is another investment adviser, including financial planners.

Question: registered municipal advisor
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a registered municipal advisor.

Question: registered security-based swap dealer
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a registered security-based swap dealer.

Question: major security-based swap participant
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a major security-based swap participant.

Question: commodity pool operator or commodity trading advisor (whether registered or exempt from registration)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a commodity pool operator or commodity trading advisor, regardless of registration status.

Question: futures commission merchant
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a futures commission merchant.

Question: banking or thrift institution
Expected Data Element: Related Person Banking or Thrift Institution [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a banking or thrift institution.

Question: trust company
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a trust company.

Question: accountant or accounting firm
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is an accountant or accounting firm.

Question: lawyer or law firm
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a lawyer or law firm.

Question: insurance company or agency
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is an insurance company or agency.

Question: pension consultant
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a pension consultant.

Question: real estate broker or dealer
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a real estate broker or dealer.

Question: sponsor or syndicator of limited partnerships (or equivalent), excluding pooled investment vehicles
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a sponsor or syndicator of limited partnerships or equivalent, excluding pooled investment vehicles.

Question: sponsor, general partner, managing member (or equivalent) of pooled investment vehicles
Business Definition: Indicates whether the related person is a sponsor, general partner, or managing member of pooled investment vehicles.

Question: Are you an adviser to any private fund? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the firm advises any private funds.

Question: Do you or any related person: (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons have proprietary interests in client transactions.

Question: buy securities for yourself from advisory clients, or sell securities you own to advisory clients (principal transactions)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser buys securities for themselves from advisory clients, or sells securities they own to advisory clients, known as principal transactions.

Question: buy or sell for yourself securities (other than shares of mutual funds) that you also recommend to advisory clients?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser buys or sells for themselves securities that they also recommend to advisory clients.

Question: recommend securities (or other investment products) to advisory clients in which you or any related person has some other proprietary (ownership) interest (other than those mentioned in Items 8.A.(1) or (2))?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser recommends securities or other investment products in which the adviser or any related person has a proprietary interest.

Question: Do you or any related person: (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons have sales interests in client transactions.

Question: as a broker-dealer or registered representative of a broker-dealer, execute securities trades for brokerage customers in which advisory client securities are sold to or bought from the brokerage customer (agency cross transactions)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser, as a broker-dealer or registered representative, executes securities trades for brokerage customers in which advisory client securities are involved.

Question: recommend to advisory clients, or act as a purchaser representative for advisory clients with respect to, the purchase of securities for which you or any related person serves as underwriter or general or managing partner?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser recommends or acts on behalf of advisory clients to purchase securities for which the adviser or related persons serve as underwriter/managing partner.

Question: recommend purchase or sale of securities to advisory clients for which you or any related person has any other sales interest (other than the receipt of sales commissions as a broker or registered representative of a broker-dealer)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser recommends the purchase or sale of securities to advisory clients where there is another sales interest besides receiving sales commissions.

Question: Do you or any related person have discretionary authority to determine the: (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons have discretionary authority over specifying client transactions.

Question: securities to be bought or sold for a client's account?
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons possess discretionary authority to decide which securities are bought or sold for client accounts.

Question: amount of securities to be bought or sold for a client's account?
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons have discretionary power to determine the quantity of securities bought or sold for client accounts.

Question: broker or dealer to be used for a purchase or sale of securities for a client's account?
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons hold discretionary authority to select the broker or dealer for client securities transactions.

Question: commission rates to be paid to a broker or dealer for a client's securities transactions?
Business Definition: Indicates if the adviser or related persons exercise discretionary authority regarding commission rates paid to brokers or dealers for client transactions.

Question: If you answer 'yes' to Item 8.C.(3), are any of the brokers or dealers related persons? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether brokers or dealers selected with discretionary authority are related persons.

Question: Do you or any related person recommend brokers or dealers to clients? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or related persons recommend brokers or dealers to clients.

Question: If you answer 'yes' to Item 8.E, are any of the brokers or dealers related persons? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the recommended brokers or dealers include related persons.

Question: Do you or any related person receive research or other products or services other than execution from a broker-dealer or a third party ('soft dollar benefits') in connection with client securities transactions? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or related persons receive research or other services aside from execution (soft dollar benefits) from broker-dealers or third parties.

Question: If 'yes' to Item 8.G(1), are all the 'soft dollar benefits' you or any related persons receive eligible 'research or brokerage services' under section 28(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the "soft dollar benefits" received are eligible "research or brokerage services" as defined by section 28(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

Question: Do you or any related person, directly or indirectly, compensate any person that is not an employee for client referrals? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any related person provides compensation to any non-employee for client referrals.

Question: Do you or any related person, directly or indirectly, provide any employee compensation that is specifically related to obtaining clients for the firm (cash or non-cash compensation in addition to the employee's regular salary)? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or related persons provide additional compensation to employees specifically for obtaining clients for the firm.

Question: Do you or any related person, including any employee, directly or indirectly, receive compensation from any person (other than you or any related person) for client referrals? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any related person, including employees, receives compensation from any person other than the adviser or related persons for client referrals.

Question: In your response to Item 8.I., do not include the regular salary you pay to an employee.
Business Definition: Indicates that the response should exclude the regular salary paid to an employee when considering compensation from client referrals.

Question: In responding to Items 8.H and 8.I, consider all cash and non-cash compensation that you or a related person gave to (in answering Item 8.H.) or received from (in answering Item 8.I.) any person in exchange for client referrals, including any bonus that is based, at least in part, on the number or amount of client referrals.
Business Definition: Indicates that responses to Items 8.H and 8.I should include all forms of cash and non-cash compensation related to client referrals, including bonuses.

Question: Do you have custody of any advisory clients': (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser has custody of any advisory clients' assets.

Question: cash or bank accounts?
Expected Data Element: Custody of Cash or Bank Accounts [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser has custody of clients' cash or bank accounts.

Question: securities?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser has custody of clients' securities.

Question: If you checked 'yes' to Item 9.A(1)(a) or (b), what is the approximate amount of client funds and securities and the total number of clients for which you have custody:
U.S. Dollar Amount
Expected Data Element: Custody Amount – Client Funds and Securities ($)
Business Definition: The approximate amount of client funds and securities in U.S. dollars for which the adviser has custody.

Question: Total Number of Clients
Business Definition: The total number of clients for which the adviser has custody of client funds and securities.

Question: In connection with advisory services you provide to clients, do any of your related persons have custody of any of your advisory clients': (Yes/No)
Expected Data Element: Related Persons Custody of Client Assets [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether related persons have custody of any advisory clients' assets in connection with advisory services.

Question: cash or bank accounts?
Expected Data Element: Related Persons Custody of Cash or Bank Accounts [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether related persons have custody of clients' cash or bank accounts.

Question: securities?
Business Definition: Indicates whether related persons have custody of clients' securities.

Question: If you checked 'yes' to Item 9.B(1)(a) or (b), what is the approximate amount of client funds and securities and the total number of clients for which your related persons have custody:
U.S. Dollar Amount
Business Definition: The approximate amount of client funds and securities in U.S. dollars for which related persons have custody.

Question: Total Number of Clients
Expected Data Element: Related Persons Custody – Total Number of Clients
Business Definition: The total number of clients for which related persons have custody of client funds and securities.

Question: If you or your related persons have custody of client funds or securities in connection with advisory services you provide to clients, check all the following that apply:
Business Definition: Indicates the applicable custody arrangements if the adviser or related persons have custody of client funds or securities.

Question: A qualified custodian(s) sends account statements at least quarterly to the investors in the pooled investment vehicle(s) you manage.
Business Definition: Indicates whether a qualified custodian sends account statements at least quarterly to the investors in the pooled investment vehicle(s) managed by the adviser.

Question: An independent public accountant audits annually the pooled investment vehicle(s) that you manage and the audited financial statements are distributed to the investors in the pools.
Expected Data Element: Annual Audit by Independent Public Accountant [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether an independent public accountant audits the pooled investment vehicle(s) annually and distributes the audited financial statements to the investors.

Question: An independent public accountant conducts an annual surprise examination of client funds and securities.
Business Definition: Indicates whether an independent public accountant conducts an annual surprise examination of client funds and securities.

Question: An independent public accountant prepares an internal control report with respect to custodial services when you or your related persons are qualified custodians for client funds and securities.
Business Definition: Indicates whether an independent public accountant prepares an internal control report concerning custodial services when you or related persons are qualified custodians.

Question: Do you or your related person(s) act as qualified custodians for your clients in connection with advisory services you provide to clients? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or related persons act as qualified custodians for clients in connection with advisory services.

Question: you act as a qualified custodian
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser acts as a qualified custodian.

Question: your related person(s) act as qualified custodian(s)
Expected Data Element: Related Persons Act as Qualified Custodian [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether related persons act as qualified custodians.

Question: If you are filing your annual updating amendment and you were subject to a surprise examination by an independent public accountant during your last fiscal year, provide the date (MM/YYYY) the examination commenced:
Business Definition: The date (month and year) when the surprise examination by an independent public accountant commenced.

Question: If you or your related persons have custody of client funds or securities, how many persons, including, but not limited to, you and your related persons, act as qualified custodians for your clients in connection with advisory services you provide to clients?
Business Definition: The total number of persons, including the adviser and related persons, acting as qualified custodians for clients in connection with advisory services.

Question: Does any person not named in Item 1.A. or Schedules A, B, or C, directly or indirectly, control your management or policies? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether any person not already listed directly or indirectly controls the management or policies of the adviser.

Question: If yes, complete Section 10.A. of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Instruction to complete Section 10.A. of Schedule D if there is external control of management or policies.

Question: If any person named in Schedules A, B, or C or in Section 10.A. of Schedule D is a public reporting company under Sections 12 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, please complete Section 10.B. of Schedule D.
Business Definition: Indicates whether any person listed in Schedules A, B, or C, or Section 10.A. of Schedule D, is a public reporting company under Sections 12 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

Question: Do any of the events below involve you or any of your supervised persons? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any supervised persons are involved in any specified regulatory or legal events.

Question: In the past ten years, have you or any advisory affiliate:
been convicted of or pled guilty or nolo contendere ('no contest') in a domestic, foreign, or military court to any felony?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been convicted of or pled guilty or nolo contendere ('no contest') to any felony.

Question: been charged with any felony?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been charged with any felony.

Question: In the past ten years, have you or any advisory affiliate:

been convicted of or pled guilty or nolo contendere ('no contest') in a domestic, foreign, or military court to a misdemeanor involving: investments or an investment-related business, or any fraud, false statements, or omissions, wrongful taking of property, bribery, perjury, forgery, counterfeiting, extortion, or a conspiracy to commit any of these offenses?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been convicted of or pled guilty or nolo contendere to a misdemeanor involving specified offenses.

Question: been charged with a misdemeanor listed in Item 11.B.(1)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been charged with a specified misdemeanor.

Question: Has the SEC or the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) ever:
found you or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the SEC or CFTC has found the adviser or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission.

Question: found you or any advisory affiliate to have been involved in a violation of SEC or CFTC regulations or statutes?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been found to be involved in a violation of SEC or CFTC regulations or statutes.

Question: found you or any advisory affiliate to have been a cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted?
Expected Data Element: Cause of Business Denial by SEC/CFTC [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been a cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted by the SEC or CFTC.

Question: entered an order against you or any advisory affiliate in connection with investment-related activity?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the SEC or CFTC has entered an order against the adviser or any advisory affiliate in connection with investment-related activity.

Question: imposed a civil money penalty on you or any advisory affiliate, or ordered you or any advisory affiliate to cease and desist from any activity?
Expected Data Element: Civil Money Penalty/Cease and Desist by SEC/CFTC [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the SEC or CFTC has imposed a civil money penalty or ordered a cease and desist from any activity on the adviser or any advisory affiliate.

Question: Has any other federal regulatory agency, any state regulatory agency, or any foreign financial regulatory authority:
ever found you or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission, or been dishonest, unfair, or unethical?
Expected Data Element: Found False Statement/Omission by Other Regulators [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether any other federal regulatory agency, state regulatory agency, or foreign financial regulatory authority has found the adviser or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission, or been dishonest, unfair, or unethical.

Question: ever found you or any advisory affiliate to have been involved in a violation of investment-related regulations or statutes?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been found to be involved in a violation of investment-related regulations or statutes by other regulators.

Question: ever found you or any advisory affiliate to have been a cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted?
Expected Data Element: Cause of Business Denial by Other Regulators [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been a cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted by other regulators.

Question: in the past ten years, entered an order against you or any advisory affiliate in connection with an investment-related activity?
Business Definition: Indicates whether, in the past ten years, any other regulator has entered an order against the adviser or any advisory affiliate in connection with an investment-related activity.

Question: ever denied, suspended, or revoked your or any advisory affiliate's registration or license, or otherwise prevented you or any advisory affiliate, by order, from associating with an investment-related business or restricted your or any advisory affiliate's activity?
Business Definition: Indicates whether any other regulator has denied, suspended, or revoked the adviser's or any advisory affiliate's registration or license, or otherwise prevented them from associating with an investment-related business or restricted their activity.

Question: Has any self-regulatory organization or commodities exchange ever:
found you or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission?
Business Definition: Indicates whether any self-regulatory organization or commodities exchange has found the adviser or any advisory affiliate to have made a false statement or omission.

Question: found you or any advisory affiliate to have been involved in a violation of its rules (other than a violation designated as a 'minor rule violation' under a plan approved by the SEC)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been found to be involved in a violation of rules by a self-regulatory organization or commodities exchange.

Question: found you or any advisory affiliate to have been the cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted?
Expected Data Element: Cause of Business Denial by SRO/Exchange [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate has been the cause of an investment-related business having its authorization to do business denied, suspended, revoked, or restricted by an SRO/commodities exchange.

Question: disciplined you or any advisory affiliate by expelling or suspending you or the advisory affiliate from membership, barring or suspending you or the advisory affiliate from association with other members, or otherwise restricting your or the advisory affiliate's activities?
Business Definition: Indicates whether any self-regulatory organization or commodities exchange has disciplined the adviser or any advisory affiliate by expelling, suspending, barring association, or otherwise restricting activities.

Question: Has an authorization to act as an attorney, accountant, or federal contractor granted to you or any advisory affiliate ever been revoked or suspended?
Business Definition: Indicates whether an authorization to act as an attorney, accountant, or federal contractor granted to the adviser or any advisory affiliate has ever been revoked or suspended.

Question: Are you or any advisory affiliate now the subject of any regulatory proceeding that could result in a 'yes' answer to any part of Item 11.C., 11.D., or 11.E.?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate is currently the subject of any regulatory proceeding that could result in a 'yes' answer to any part of Items 11.C., 11.D., or 11.E.

Question: For 'yes' answers to the following questions, complete a Civil Judicial Action DRP:
(a) "Has any domestic or foreign court: in the past ten years enjoined you or any advisory affiliate in connection with any investment-related activity?"
Business Definition: Indicates whether any domestic or foreign court has enjoined the adviser or any advisory affiliate in connection with any investment-related activity in the past ten years.

Question: ever found that you or any advisory affiliate were involved in a violation of investment-related statutes or regulations?
Business Definition: Indicates whether any domestic or foreign court has found the adviser or any advisory affiliate was involved in a violation of investment-related statutes or regulations.

Question: ever dismissed, pursuant to a settlement agreement, an investment-related civil action brought against you or any advisory affiliate by a state or foreign financial regulatory authority?
Business Definition: Indicates whether any domestic or foreign court has dismissed, pursuant to a settlement agreement, an investment-related civil action against the adviser or any advisory affiliate.

Question: Are you or any advisory affiliate now the subject of any civil proceeding that could result in a 'yes' answer to any part of Item 11.H.(1)?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser or any advisory affiliate is now the subject of any civil proceeding that could result in a 'yes' answer to any part of Item 11.H.(1).

Question: The SEC is required by the Regulatory Flexibility Act to consider the effect of its regulations on small entities. In order to do this, we need to determine whether you meet the definition of 'small business' or 'small organization' under rule 0-7.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser needs to provide information to determine compliance with the Regulatory Flexibility Act.

Question: Answer this Item 12 only if you are registered or registering with the SEC and you indicated in response to Item 5.F.(2)(c) that you have regulatory assets under management of less than $25 million. You are not required to answer this Item 12 if you are filing for initial registration as a state adviser, amending a current state registration, or switching from SEC to state registration.
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is required to answer Item 12 based on the criteria specified.

Question: For purposes of this Item 12 only: 'Total Assets refers to the total assets of a firm, rather than the assets managed on behalf of clients. In determining your or another person's total assets, you may use the total assets shown on a current balance sheet (but use total assets reported on a consolidated balance sheet with subsidiaries included, if that amount is larger).'
Business Definition: Definition of total assets for the purpose of responding to Item 12.

Question: 'Control means the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise. Any person that directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of the voting securities, or is entitled to 25 percent or more of the profits, of another person is presumed to control the other person.'
Business Definition: Definition of control for the purpose of responding to Item 12.

Question: Did you have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of your most recent fiscal year? (Yes/No)
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

Question: If 'yes,' you do not need to answer Items 12.B. and 12.C.
Business Definition: Indicates that no response is needed for Items 12.B. and 12.C. if Item 12.A is answered 'yes.'

Question: Do you: control another investment adviser that had regulatory assets under management (calculated in response to Item 5.F.(2)(c) of Form ADV) of $25 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser controls another investment adviser with regulatory assets under management of $25 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

Question: Do you: control another person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser controls another entity (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year.

Question: Are you: controlled by or under common control with another investment adviser that had regulatory assets under management (calculated in response to Item 5.F.(2)(c) of Form ADV) of $25 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year?
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is controlled by or under common control with another investment adviser that had regulatory assets under management of $25 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year.

Question: Are you: controlled by or under common control with another person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year?
Expected Data Element: Controlled by Entity with ≥$5M Total Assets [Yes/No]
Business Definition: Indicates whether the adviser is controlled by or under common control with another entity (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of its most recent fiscal year.
